description: On January 21, Hubei announced that health administrative departments at all levels should strengthen the management, guidance, supervision and inspection of epidemic reports. Those who report, conceal, omission or make false reports shall be investigated for the responsibilities of relevant units and individuals in accordance with the law.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels within the province to cooperate effectively with organization departments to give full play to the role of the rural grassroots party organization as a fighting fortress and the active role of the village committee, and organize and mobilize the peasants and the mass, making them not to believe in rumors or spread rumors.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that all colleges and universities must use campus networks, Weibo, Wechat public accounts, teacher group chats, student group chats, parent group chats, etc., through announcements, warm reminders, a letter to teachers and students, etc., to educate and guide teachers, students, and parents not to believe or spread rumors.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Education,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: China, on 04 Feb 2020, Guangdong provincial government posted its requirement regarding pandemic disinformation. When a residential area or its surrounding area discovers an infected person, the local residential management should aid the county residential committee to help to alert the nearby residents, inform them of the next step quarantine guidelines. The local residential reporting must be based on truthful, reliable, identifiable, and verifiable sources or facts. The local residential management team must not fabricate information or transmit false information.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: In Xinjiang, from Jul. 25 onwards, if someone spreads rumours about epidemic situations, false police information, or intentionally disrupt public order during the epidemic period according to Article 25 of the Law on Public Security Administration Punishments, he/she has to detain for more than 5 days and less than 10 days, a fine of less than 500 yuan will be concurrently imposed. If the circumstances are minor, there will be detention for less than 5 days or a fine of less than 500 yuan.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Department of Education of Hubei ordered the Department of Education of all levels in the province to, according to the teaching scale and conditions within their jurisdiction, coordinate comprehensively all forces, integrate and mobilize educational resources, and carry out online teaching, independent learning, and online guidance and question-answering through the Internet, TV, mobiles, etc., and strive to ensure that all primary and secondary schools (including secondary vocational schools) postponed the start of school and kept teaching, while students postponed going to school and kept studying. The departments should not organize gathered learning and training, and should minimize personnel flow and contact as much as possible, conducting work on the premise of ensuring the safety of teachers and students.
The departments should do proper overall planning of the amount of resources and time used in each subject, appropriately reduce the content, slow down the progress, and ensure the content being standard, not increasing the burden on students, teachers and parents. The departments should attach great importance to guiding students to protect their eyesight, control the duration of online learning units, enrich teaching content and forms, and strengthen physical exercise guidance.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Education,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that during the prevention and control period, schools at all levels and types must not open in advance, and students who returned home during the Spring Festival should not return to school in advance without notice. 
Except for the need for epidemic prevention and control, the schools should not arrange staff and teachers for business trips or visits.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Prevention and Control Headquarters of the Educational Work Committee of the Hubei Party Committee and the Education Department of Hubei announced that all colleges and universities shall implement fully closed management of campuses before the official opening of the spring semester and strictly control the entry and exit of outsiders. For personnel and vehicles that needed to enter or exit the campus due to prevention and control work and other special reasons, the schools must register them one by one and conduct temperature checks on the relevant personnel. If their temperature exceeds 37.3℃, the schools must resolutely discourage them from entering and leaving and guide them to seek medical treatment in time. Except for the work and life necessities of teachers and students in universities, classrooms, laboratories, sports venues, libraries, and other public places on campus would be closed temporarily. The schools must study in advance campus prevention and control work plans for after the beginning of school.

description:
On Feb 14, Henan, China announced that schools would reopen after Mar 1. Art Matriculation Examination (including dance and music) would be delayed until senior high school students came back to school. Besides, schools were encouraged to teach online.

description:
The department of education of Henan, China issued policies regarding to reopening the schools on Mar 9. 
Schools must strictly control the number of entrances and exits. Usually only one gate is allowed to open per campus, subject to change (open more during peak hours to avoid gatherings).
All faculty, staff and students who enter the campus should show health certificates and conduct temperature tests. Schools must be equipped with necessary temperature detection equipment (set up thermal temperature scanners at entrance if possible).
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Education Department of Sichuan Province decided that schools were allowed to resume since April 1st. Year 12 students could return to schools since April 1st and the return-school decision should be made by the provincial government. Year 9 students could return since April 7th and the return-school decision should be made by the municipal governments. Students of the other years could return to schools year by year separately, based on the severity of pandemic, after year 9 and year 12 fully returned.

Year 9 students could return since April 7th and the return-school decision should be made by the municipal governments. Students of the other years could return to schools year by year separately, based on the severity of pandemic, after year 9 and year 12 fully returned.

description:
Starting May 07, 2020, the Chinese national government released new guidelines for the reopening of primary and secondary schools: 

1) Document all returning staff and student and check temperature at school entrance. 
2) Must conduct 14 days of self-quarantine before returning 
3) Daily health monitoring during morning and nights. Must report data daily to local government 
4) Health monitoring/reporting of families of staff and students 
5) Surveillance of health risks on campus. Daily sterilization of public areas, hand-washing and drinking services, and trash collection.
6) Control population density on campus, maintain social distancing protocols. Different school start times, lunch times, and end times should vary to prevent mass gatherings.
7) Restriction on all mass gatherings such as conferences, meetings. 
8) Strengthen COVID-19 education for returning students and staff
9) Encourage collaboration and communication with parents. 
10) Open psychological counseling, mental health related services, hotlines. 
11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On Dec. 19 10:00, China released its two-step vaccination plan. The first step is to vaccinate people within focus group, and the second step is to vaccinate the remaining people.

People within the focus group includes those who are engaged in imported cold-chain products, port quarantine, ships pilotage, air crew, fresh food market, public transportation, medical disease control.

description:
Jilin Province is currently vaccinating the COVID-19 vaccine for five groups of people.
On January 17, new epidemic prevention and control work at a news conference, jilin province government workers in response to reporters' questions when the link is introduced, the current jilin province is the key crowd new conduct of vaccination, at present there are five kinds of new crown vaccine key crowd: one is involved in the import port of cold-chain items of a line of the customs, inspection and quarantine personnel, port loading and unloading, handling, transportation and other related personnel; Second, international and domestic transportation personnel; 3. Border port personnel who go abroad for work or study for business or private reasons and are at high risk of overseas epidemic diseases; Fourth, medical and health personnel; Fifth, the urban operation guarantee personnel (including government agencies, public security, armed police, fire, community workers, water, electricity, heating, coal, gas related personnel, and engaged in transportation, logistics, elderly care, sanitation, funeral, communications and other related personnel.
Jilin province carried out in accordance with the principle of voluntary and free COVID-19 vaccine rules, vaccination age should be between the ages of 18 and 59 without vaccination taboo.
type_sub_cat: Distribution (shipping; storage; administration) of COVID-19 vaccines
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that personnel and vehicles entering and leaving the city must have passes of the national, provincial, and county (district) or above level, to pass through after strict inspection, verification, and filing. Freight vehicles carrying prescriptive epidemic prevention materials and life support materials can pass directly after inspection and filing. Medical personnel vehicles needed for epidemic prevention and control can pass with identification. Vehicles transporting patients can leave the city with the transfer (diagnosis) certificate, but relevant personnel are not allowed to return until the epidemic is over. Other vehicles and personnel are strictly forbidden to enter the city.

description: On February 8, Xiantao, Hubei formulated the "Implementation Plan for the Return of People in Xiantao to Hubei and Wuhan for Work during the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Epidemic". According to the plan, people in Xiantao returning to Hubei and Wuhan for work need to hold the return certificate approved by the prevention and control headquarters of the destination county (city, district) and the return consent certificate issued by the epidemic prevention and control headquarters of the currently located town (street, field, park, district). For people leaving Xiantao that do not cooperate with the village (community) for registration and examination, isolation and observation; organize or participate in gathered dining, gathering activities, gambling, and other violation of relevant regulations on epidemic prevention and control, their return may not be approved.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that personnel and vehicles entering and leaving the city must have passes of the national, provincial, and county (district) or above level, to pass through after strict inspection, verification, and filing. Freight vehicles carrying prescriptive epidemic prevention materials and life support materials can pass directly after inspection and filing. Medical personnel vehicles needed for epidemic prevention and control can pass with identification. Vehicles transporting patients can leave the city with the transfer (diagnosis) certificate, but relevant personnel are not allowed to return until the epidemic is over. On February 13, Xiantao announced that for cross-city transportation of livestock and poultry feed; veterinary drugs, vaccines, livestock, and poultry epidemic prevention products;  live pigs and their products; eggs;urgently need agricultural materials; fruits and vegetables that need to be listed urgently, vehicles (full or empty vehicles with no more than 2 passengers), shall be released after inspection, temperature measurement, disinfection, and registration. For the transportation of cross-city aquatic fry and rice eel and other adult fish, after having the vehicle transportation permit provided by the department of traffic transportation at the municipal epidemic prevention and control headquarters, the vehicle will be released quickly. UPDATE: The policy added specific inspection measures for particular types of vehicles.

description: On March 13, Xiantao, Hubei decided that those who leave Xiantao to go outside the province (except Beijing), with a certificate of acceptance by their destination workplace or community (village) where they live, shall apply for returning to work (return to hometown) to the headquarters of the town where they are located. With a Hubei “Health Code” (or Xiantao “Yimatong”) green code or a health certificate issued by the current headquarters of the town, under the premise of good health management and implementation of prevention and control measures, people shall adopt a "point-to-point, one-stop" measure to return to work accurately, safely, and orderly.

description:
In order to curb cross-border spread of the virus, Civil Aviation Administration of China announced that Chinese passengers who have purchased return air tickets from the countries listed in the appendix are required to fill in and report their health information in advance for epidemic prevention. Specific requirements are as follows:

1.  Starting from April 8, 2020, passengers who have purchased tickets need to log in the international version of the health QR code in the Wechat mini program to fill in their personal information, daily health status and travel history. The information can be filled in by others under special circumstances.

2.  April 8 to April 22 will be the transition period. Chinese passengers taking flights during this period shall report their information on a daily basis starting from April 8. For Chinese passengers taking flights after the transition period, their information shall be reported on a daily basis starting from the 14th day before boarding the flight.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From June 8, 2020, Singapore and China started their fast lane agreement to facilitate essential business and official travel between both countries. The fast lane will be established between six Chinese provinces and municipalities (Chongqing, Guangdong, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Tianjin and Zhejiang) and Singapore. The scheme is open to residents in Singapore and China who need to make essential business or official trips between the two countries, and they will be exempt from rules that require everyone else to serve quarantine periods of up to 14 days. They must first agree to be tested and bear the costs.

description: Effective from 0 a m., 28 September 2020, foreign nationals holding valid Chinese residence permits for work, personal matters and reunion are allowed to enter China with no need for applying for new visas. If the above three categories of residence permits held by foreign nationals expired after 0 a.m., 28 March 2020, the holders may apply for relevant visas by presenting the expired residence permits and relevant materials to the Chinese embassies or consulates on the condition that the purpose of the holders’ visit to China remains unchanged. The above-mentioned personnel shall strictly abide by the Chinese regulations on epidemic prevention and control. description:
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, China has decided to temporarily suspend entry into China by non-Chinese nationals in the UK holding visas or residence permits still valid at the time of this announcement. The Chinese Embassy and Consulates in the UK will no longer issue Certified Health Declaration Form for the above-mentioned personnel.

Entry by holders of diplomatic, service, courtesy or C visas will not be affected. Foreign nationals visiting China for emergency needs may apply for visas at Chinese Embassy or Consulates. Entry by non-Chinese nationals in the UK with visas issued after 3 November 2020 will not be affected.

description: In order to reduce cross-border transmission of COVID-19 and protect the health and safety of passengers, China starting from 0:00 on November 6, 2020 Pacific Time, all Chinese and foreign passengers bound for China will be required to take nucleic acid and IgM anti-body tests and apply for a green health code with the "HS" mark or a certified health declaration form before boarding the flight.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As from 0:00 on December 1, 2020 Pacific Time, the Chinese Embassy/Consulates General will issue QR code with "HDC" mark for foreign passengers who are to fly from the U.S. to China. Foreign passengers can apply for the QR code with "HDC" mark by logging on the website of https://hrhk.cs.mfa.gov.cn/H5/ via computer or smart phone. The passengers can fill in their information, declare their health status and upload the test certificates, passports, itinerary and other documents as required online, which will then be examined and verified by the Chinese Embassy/Consulates in the U.S. Upon approval, they will receive the QR code with "HDC" mark. Foreign passengers must present the electronic or printed code, and follow the procedures for inspection by relevant airlines during boarding. For test requirements please read the Embassy notice on 29th October 2020 carefully.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Dec.7th, the Taiping region of Chengdu City was classified to "medium risk" after confirmation of 5 local covid cases. On Dec.8th, the Disease Control Department of Henan Province issued all travellers arriving from the Taiping region since Nov. 23rd to report to the local unit to participate in safety investigation (e.g. report travelling history, recent activities and contacts, proof of negative covid test in recent 7 days). The department also strongly suggested those travellers arriving from other regions of Chengdu since Nov. 23rd to monitor their health condition. All residents should not travel to Chengdu or any regions at risk unless it's essential. Those that are travelling must report to the local unit for record-keeping. The policy has ended on Dec.21st, after the Taiping region is reclassified to "low risk" with no new cases identified in the 2 weeks period.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 13, Xiantao, Hubei decided that those who need to return to Xiantao from medium and low-risk areas in the province must hold a Hubei "health code" green code or a health monitoring certificate, and pass through the control points after inspection, registration and temperature measurement; people from high-risk areas in the province can return by a “point-to-point” method, holding a Hubei "Health Code" green code or health monitoring certificate, and approved by the municipal headquarters for the pandemic prevention and control.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
一、要严格履行报告制度。自12月6日以来广州市南沙区返（来）吉人员须第一时间主动向所在单位、村（社区）或所住宾馆报告，如实提供活动轨迹和个人健康状况，对因瞒报、谎报造成严重后果的，依法追究法律责任。

　　二、要安全合理安排出行。凡有广州市南沙区旅居史的返（来）吉人员，须第一时间接受核酸检测，尽量不外出、不聚集、不聚餐，一旦出现发热、咳嗽等疑似症状，立即向村（社区）工作人员报告，专人专车转运至定点医院就诊。并在官方公布相关地区风险等级后立即更新相应风险等级管控措施。

三、要落实排查管控机制。各行管部门、各乡(镇)街、开发区、村（社区）要继续强化网格化日常管控要求，做好对广州市南沙区旅居史返（来）吉人员的排查登记和管控工作。住宿单位要严格落实住宿人员登记制度，要详细询问旅居史，如发现上述重点地区旅居史人员立即报告。
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government

description:
irst, we must strictly implement the reporting system. Since December 6, the personnel who have returned (returned) from Nansha District of Guangzhou shall take the initiative to report to their work unit, village (community) or hotel where they live, truthfully provide their activity track and personal health status. Those who conceal or falsely report serious consequences will be investigated for legal responsibility according to law.

Second, we should make safe and reasonable travel arrangements. Those who have a history of living in Nansha District of Guangzhou shall receive nucleic acid testing as soon as possible, and try not to go out, gather or dine together. In case of fever, cough and other suspected symptoms, they shall immediately report to the village (community) staff and be transported to the designated hospital by special person and car. The relevant risk level control measures shall be updated immediately after the official announcement of the risk level of relevant areas.

Third, to implement the investigation and control mechanism. All administrative departments, townships (towns) streets, development zones, villages (communities) should continue to strengthen the requirements of grid daily control, and do a good job in the investigation, registration and control of the personnel who have returned (returned) from their residence history in Nansha District, Guangzhou. UPDATE: Same as upper answer. I just want to translate the Chinese version of description into English.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government

description: On January 21, Hubei announced that all airports, stations, wharfs and other transportation hubs in the province should set up body temperature detection points to implement body temperature detection and complete health registration for all personnel entering the station. Those who are found to have suspected symptoms will be temporarily isolated for inspection and transferred to the medical institutions designated by the local health administrative department.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On January 21, 2020, Hubei announced that the urban and rural grassroots organizations should conduct health registration of returnees and incoming visitors from the epidemic area one by one, follow up their health status in time, and report immediately if fever, cough, etc. was found. On January 22, 2020, Hubei announced that permanent residents should be checked as well. UPDATE: The original policy targeted only returning people and visitors, it has been changed to include also permanent residents.

description: On January 22, 2020, Hubei announced that community prevention and control work must be fully initiated. The neighborhood committees (village committees) shall establish a community prevention and control work organization system, implement grid-based and thorough management, strengthen household inspection and registration, and understand the health status of permanent residents, migrants, and returnees. People who have fever or cough should be reminded to seek medical treatment as soon as possible.

The schools must accurately and dynamically understand the confirmed cases, suspected cases, fever, etc. among teachers and students.

description: Fujian Province has created a classification system to divide up their 84 counties in regards to their coronavirus situation. These include an "epidemic free area": no new cases after 14 days, "sporadic epidemic area": less than 4 confirmed cases, "general epidemic area": 5-9 confirmed cases occur, and finally "area w/more cases": 10 or more confirmed cases occur. Each category with their own rules/regulations for how to respond to their situation.

description: Henan, China launched an online Health Certificate Declaration System on Feb 21. Workers who will return to work must submit significant information online, including individual health status, 14-day travel history, the history of contact with patients with confirmed and probable diagnoses of COVID-19 etc. Medical institutions will check the information and issue Health Certificate to each person. Workers with Health Certificate do not need to self-quarantine while returning to work.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
Henan, China issued a series of policies to prevent infections in medical institutions and protect medical personnel from being infected on Feb 28. 
For example, medical institutions are required to set up checkpoints at the entrance and exit of the areas reported/potentially reported cases of COVID-19. Supervisors should be set up in order to provide guidance and assistance to medical staff in putting on and taking off protective equipment. They must be familiar with the the use of personal protective equipment and the methods of dealing with occupational exposure.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 2, based on the three-level response regulation, the government of Sichuan implements the new quarantine rules in the high risk areas.

People living in residential communities in large cities with high population density are under health monitoring and medical observation. If the condition permits, medical observation will be conducted in single room for every person.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
Henan, China launched the digital "health status code" on Mar 17, which has three "colors", indicating health assessment of a person.
"Red code" is for people who are diagnosed or to be diagnosed with coronavirus. They must be treated in designated hospitals. 
"Yellow code" is for people who have symptoms like fever, coughing, a sore throat and shortness of breath or who are cured in less than 14 days. They must be self-quarantined under supervision of the community.
"Green code" is for the rest of people. One with the "green code" and a normal temperature can travel or return to work within/between provinces.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 25, 2020, Hubei announced that economic and information bureaus of all cities, prefectures, municipalities directly under management, and forest districts in the province must establish a system for uniformly deploying new-type pneumonia protective materials from that day. 
All bureaus must appoint special personnel to the designated factories and establish a station system of one factory (or multiple factories) per person. 
The scope of product monitoring includes surgical masks (including N95 masks), medical protective clothing, disinfection products, protective masks, goggles, positive pressure isolation gowns, etc. 
The responsibilities of the stationed personnel are: immediately take the strictest measures urging enterprises to hand over all epidemic prevention materials to the Material Guarantee Team of the Provincial Headquarters for Prevention and Control. Following the allocation plan issued by the province, appointed personnel should notify the enterprises to organize production, and should supervise and manage the existing inventory, daily output, planned allocation, statistics on in and out of warehouses, and the next day's production schedule.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that if a patient with COVID-19 (including suspected patients) died, their medical institution shall issue the death medical certificate, and perform sanitation and epidemic prevention work such as disinfection of the remains. For the remains of patients with COVID-19 (including suspected patients) who had died outside medical institutions, the local health department should arrange medical staff from medical and health institutions to visit and perform sanitation and epidemic prevention treatments as required.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
Pandemic Emergency Command Center in Sichuan declared that factories which manufactured resources helping the prevention of the pandemic, including facemasks, personal protection equipments and electrical thermometers, should resume their production on January 30. The provincial government would appoint liaison officers to coordinate with those factories on material supply, manufacture equipments, logistics, energy and finance.

The provincial government offered tax reduction for the factories which manufactured resources helping the prevention of the pandemic. Also, banks and financial institutions were ordered to offer better interest rates to those factories.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On March 14, it was announced that Chinese doctors were coming to work in Tunisia. Stocks of antibacterial gels and protective masks will also be supplied by China. According to Doctor Dhaker Lahidheb, a doctor practicing at the Tunis Military Hospital, a team of high-level Chinese doctors will soon travel to Tunisia, provided with effective drugs designed, according to him, to fight against the coronavirus.
In a statement released the same evening, the Presidency of the Republic of Tunisia welcomed the Chinese initiative.

description: On January 27th, Luohe held an emergency coronavirus response drill in the city square of Shiwulidian Village, Longcheng Town. More than 220 participants participated in the drill. They were staff members from public security, transportation, medical and disease control center, primary medical care unit, emergency transfer, inspection testing and safety assurance. The drill prepared the staffing members in case of residents returning from other areas started to show susceptible symptoms such as coughing and fatigue. Starting with risk evaluation at the village clinic, to case report, emergency transfer, root cause investigation, disinfection, village-wide quarantine and nucleic acid testing etc. The drill was put in place at this critical time to prepare the staffing members for the Chinese New Year holiday, which increases the risk of entering the virus from outside the village.

description:
Hebei, China issued the Guidelines for preventive disinfection in schools and kindergartens on February 1st, 2020 to provide instructions on how to use disinfectants. Daily cleaning and preventive disinfection focuses on cleaning, supplemented by preventive disinfection. Over-disinfection should be avoided, and cleaning and disinfection should be carried out at any time when contaminated.
　　(1) Air disinfection in classrooms, libraries and other places: natural ventilation is preferred, and doors and windows should be opened for ventilation as much as possible; the air-conditioning system should ensure the safety of air supply, and the exhaust air should be directly discharged outdoors, without the use of chemical disinfectants everywhere.
　　(2) Environmental surface disinfection: regularly disinfect the ground, wall, elevator and other surfaces.
　　(3) Disinfection of frequently used or touched items: 0.1% peroxyacetic acid solution and chlorine (bromine) disinfectant solution with an effective chlorine (bromine) content of 500 mg/L can be used on tables, chairs, faucets, etc. that are in contact with the human body , Chlorine dioxide solution with a chlorine dioxide content of 250mg/L is regularly wiped or sprayed for disinfection. After 30 minutes of action, wipe with clean water to remove residual disinfectant.
　　(4) Disinfection of tableware: circulating steam disinfection for 20 minutes; or boiling for 15-30 minutes; or using a far-infrared disinfecti
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 27, 2020, the Department of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of Hubei ordered all Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments within the province to, under the unified leadership of the local party committee and government (the epidemic prevention and control command headquarters), effectively perform departmental responsibilities, strengthen organization leadership, set up special work teams, specify the responsibility of product transportation to each individual personnel, check on the progress daily, and strengthen government duties. 
The departments must establish a working mechanism for the transportation of “vegetable basket” products and feed and other production inputs with relevant departments, and clarify the docking and coordination of designated personnel. They must make plans, strengthen scheduling, and adjust surplus and shortages. They should guide the business entities to prepare a transportation plan, clarifying the transportation vehicles, passengers (only drivers and brokers), and past routes, and coordinating them into transportation channels. The departments should cooperate with relevant departments to open up “green channels”, set up designated channels, and implement measures such as “point-to-point” transportation to ensure smooth transportation of urgently needed materials such as vegetables and feed.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 31, Xiantao, Hubei required that official vehicles, ambulances, fire trucks, garbage trucks, postal vehicles, emergency repair vehicles, etc. can pass directly in the city administrative area. Other vehicles can go on the road only with a vehicle pass issued by the headquarters for the prevention and control of the pandemic. For pandemic prevention work, public officials and related personnel living in the main urban area may take epidemic prevention and control work vehicles at a designated place. For enterprises producing epidemic prevention materials in the city administrative area, vehicles that need to be used can pass after inspection and verification, and vehicles to transport employees can pass through with a permit issued by the prevention and control of the pandemic. Vehicles ensuring the transportation of daily necessities in the city can pass after inspection. Social vehicles that must go to the hospital for an emergency treatment can pass after appropriate registration based on circumstances.

description: On February 17, Xiantao, Hubei set certain intersections’ all traffic lights to red lights and banned all vehicles to drive through, except authorized special vehicles including emergency transport vehicles that guaranteed supplies, official cars, postal cars, ambulances, garbage trucks, fire trucks, and funeral cars. Unauthorized passes in the intersections would be dealt with according to law by Public Security Traffic Police Department. description:
Since midnight on May 18, 2020, the epidemic prevention and control work has been further strengthened throughout the region, and strict closed control measures have been implemented in residential communities.
1.For the community (residential area) and other basic units with confirmed (including clinical diagnosis) cases, firmly implement closed and hard isolation, in principle, prohibit any personnel to enter or leave. Necessary materials for residents' daily life shall be distributed centrally by the community, and once every three days by the family. Staff and workers of organs, enterprises and institutions guaranteeing basic production and living shall enter or leave their residential communities according to their work needs on the strength of their work certificates.
2. For other communities (residential areas) with general closed management, each family shall assign one member of the family to go out once a day to purchase living materials with the community pass, and each outing is limited to 2 hours. Do not carry out according to this stipulation, exceed time, cancel the qualification of enter and exit district. Except for the needs of epidemic prevention and control, medical treatment of sick people, emergency response and provision of necessary public services, other people are not allowed to go out.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

ince midnight on May 18, 2020, the epidemic prevention and control work has been further strengthened throughout the region, and strict closed control measures have been implemented in residential communities.

description: On January 23, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels in the province to strictly implement an epidemic report system and relevant regulations on emergency duty, strengthen information reporting and work shifts, and ensure a smooth flow of government orders. In conjunction with the African Swine Fever daily report, the departments should report daily investigations on time. If an abnormal death occurred, the departments should report in time according to prescribed procedures to ensure early detection, early reporting, early diagnosis, and early disposal of the epidemic. The departments must strictly enforce disciplines of epidemic reporting, and strictly prohibit concealment, omission, late reporting, misreporting, and false reporting.
type_text: The Agriculture and Rural Departments of all levels in the province must report on animal diseases daily.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 23, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels in the province to strengthen the disease investigation of livestock and poultry in key areas and links, considering human infections. The departments should focus on live livestock and poultry trading markets, (agricultural) markets, large-scale farms, etc., combine key investigations with active monitoring, and carry out epidemiological investigations to find out the virus contamination base, to timely study and judge the internal connection between the new coronavirus and viruses carried by livestock and poultry. The departments must increase sampling and monitoring of farms and their environment, make timely epidemic risk assessments, and strengthen poultry disease prevention and control measures. The departments must actively cooperate with the forestry department in carrying out disease surveillance in wild animal domestication and breeding farms, timely sample and inspect animals that died of unknown causes and report under regulations.
type_text: The agriculture and rural affairs departments must investigate animal diseases and their connections with COVID-19
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 24, 2020, the Public Security Department of Hubei Province issued an emergency notice requesting local public security agencies to closely cooperate with relevant departments to do their best to carry out transportation support and guarantee related work.
The notice required that the Provincial Public Security Department and local public security agencies shall, under the unified deployment of the Provincial Party Committee, the Provincial Government, and the Provincial Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters, establish a working mechanism for the transportation of emergency supplies and professional medical personnel, and specify designated personnel to be responsible for docking and coordination.
If vehicles transporting emergency supplies and professional medical personnel needed coordination into Hubei, they could call the police service to be coordinated by the Provincial Public Security Transportation Administration. For transportation protection in the Wuhan City involving multiple police departments, the Wuhan Municipal Public Security Bureau Command Center would coordinate.
Local public security agencies must provide all-round traffic protection services for materials and professional and technical personnel vehicles passing by, and shall not block or lien on the grounds of road traffic control. For particular important emergency protection materials like medical equipment, police vehicles must be arranged to provide guidance.
type_text: The public security departments must support and guarantee material and medical personnel transportation
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On Dec 31 2019, Wuhan Health Commission published information about the pneumonia outbreak in Wuhan, China

On January 4, National Institute for Communicable Disease Control and Prevention, Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention said in a media interview that there had been no obvious evidence of human-to-human transmission
On January 9,  Chinese scientists announced in a media interview that a novel coronavirus had been identified as the main causative agent
On January 11, Wuhan Health Commission announced that no new cases had been found from January 3.
On January 16, Wuhan Health Commission announced that no clear evidence of human-to-human transmission has been found, but limited human-to-human transmission could not be ruled out.

On January 20, Chinese President Xi publicly addressed the crisis for the first time in a directive urging party committees and governments at all levels to take measures to curb the spread of the epidemic
On January 20, China’s National Health Commission confirmed the first cases of human-to-human transmission of the virus

On January 21, Hubei announced that all governmental districts and departments should strengthen the publicity and popularization of infectious disease prevention laws, regulations and knowledge to improve the health literacy of the people.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 21, Hubei announced that the epidemic report should be managed locally. When the military, armed police, factories, mining enterprises, schools, or other departments and their affiliated medical and health care discovers an epidemic, it must report it to the local disease prevention and control agency as required. 
The staff of various retail pharmacies and individual clinics shall inquire carefully and understand the relevant situation for those who come to buy medicines for fever and cough, and urge patients to go to the hospital in time. When finding cases or suspected cases of pneumonia infected by the new coronavirus, they must report them to the local disease prevention and control agency in the fastest way.
Governmental districts and departments should encourage the public to supervise the pneumonia epidemic caused by the new type of coronavirus. Those who are involved should promptly report to the local disease prevention and control agency or designated department.
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On 2020 May 12th, China, Guangxi Provincial Government, published a document with more specific guidance on the pandemic mask-wearing regulations after the spread has been controlled and the province has been downgraded to low risk for weeks. 

The new regulations still require mask-wearing in closed crowded areas such as public transportation and other places where the mass gathering is taking place. All personals are still required to wear masks in the hospital. Workers dealing directly with food or people are also required to wear masks whiling working. People with any covid symptoms are required to wear masks as well.

However, besides the previous requirements, people will not need to wear masks in inside space where social distancing (1 meter away) can be ensured. Outside mask-wearing is no longer required. School teachers and students will not be required to wear masks during lectures. Students located in low-risk areas will not be required to wear masks in school.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: On January 21, Hubei announced that suspected cases, confirmed cases, close contacts, and suspected exposures of new coronavirus infection should be put into quarantine. The confirmed cases shall be treated in isolation, and those who meet the discharge standards according to the relevant diagnosis and treatment plan shall be allowed to be discharged and lifted from isolation. Conduct medical observation in hospital isolation for suspected cases, and carry out laboratory investigations as soon as possible; if the new coronavirus infection is excluded by laboratory diagnosis, their quarantine can be lifted. Close contacts and suspected exposed persons shall be subject to medical observation at home or in centralized isolation, and the observation period shall be 14 days after the last contact with a case without effective protection or after a suspected exposure. During the medical observation period, if there is no fever (underarm body temperature ≥37.3°C), cough, shortness of breath and other symptoms of acute respiratory infection, the medical observation can be terminated after 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 24 2020, Inner Mongolia reported its first confirmed case of COVID-19. The Inner Mongolia government started to activate the first-level public health emergency response at noon on January 25, 2020.

Inner Mongolia strengthened the prevention of the influx of people from affected areas and implemented control measures. These measures were including on-site quarantine, on-site observation, and on-site treatment of patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients; centralized or home-based medical observation of close contacts according to their situation.

Moreover, railway, transportation, civil aviation, inspection and quarantine departments set up temporary transportation sanitation and quarantine stations at transportation stations and entry and exit ports to conduct quarantine inspections on people who entered and left Inner Mongolia. Patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients were required to temporarily quarantine，examine and transfer to designated institutions of the local health department.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On January 24 2020, Inner Mongolia reported its first confirmed case of COVID-19. The Inner Mongolia government started to activate the first-level public health emergency response at noon on January 25, 2020.

Inner Mongolia strengthened the prevention of the influx of people from affected areas and implemented control measures. These measures were including on-site quarantine, on-site observation, and on-site treatment of patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients; centralized or home-based medical observation of close contacts according to their situation.

Moreover, railway, transportation, civil aviation, inspection and quarantine departments set up temporary transportation sanitation and quarantine stations at transportation stations and entry and exit ports to conduct quarantine inspections on people who entered and left Inner Mongolia. Patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients were required to temporarily quarantine，examine and transfer to designated institutions of the local health department. UPDATE: The scope of Inner Mongolia’s new policy has been changed from "people from affected areas" to "people who travelled from Hubei"
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On March 2, based on the three-level response regulation, the government of Sichuan implements the new quarantine rules in the low risk areas. 

People from the high-risk areas:
(1) People travelling from the Coronavirus hotspots in Hubei should be subject to collective quarantine under medical observation for 14 days. (2) People travelling from the other the high-risk areas should be either subject to collective quarantine or under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (3) People travelling from the other overseas Coronavirus hotspots should be either subject to collective quarantine or be under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (4) Confirmed patients and people who display the Coronavirus symptoms can be only released after receiving treatments from proper medical institutions. (5) People who do not display the Coronavirus symptoms should be under medical observation for 14 days and have negative results of nucleic tests twice consecutively (intervals of tests should be at least one day).

People from the medium-risk areas:
(1) People travelling from the medium-risk areas should be subject to health monitoring at the community level. (2) People who contract Coronavirus and later are released from hospitals should do 14-day self isolation at home. (3) People who display fever, dry cough, shortness of breath and respiratory issues should report themselves immediately to health departments and do tests.

People from the low-risk areas:
No restriction on activities and work.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:

If the requirements above cannot be met, self-isolation at home with health observation is acceptable.

description:
On March 17, the Hainan Provincial Headquarters for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Epidemic issued the "Notice on Orderly Repatriation of People Stranded in Hubei in Our Province". According to the relevant regulations of Hubei Province, the following notices are made on the matters related to the return of Hainan residents stranded in Hubei (excluding Wuhan):

1. Those who have a history of residence in Hubei (excluding Wuhan) within 14 days can apply for returning to Hainan to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee in Hainan by telephone, email, fax, etc. in advance.

 2. The personnel returning to Hainan in Hubei shall apply to the county-level pass certificate or health monitoring certificate, he must use "point-to-point, one-stop" chartered flights, chartered vehicles or self-driving methods to return to Hainan in a precise, safe and orderly manner.

3. After arriving at the destination, people returning from Hubei to Qiong should immediately report to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee for registration, and strictly implement 14-day self-home isolation measures.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On April 20, 2020, China, Guangxi Provincial Health Department requires all arrivals to be quarantined for 28 days. Afterall arrivals, people will be required to stay in the designated inspection point and be quarantined for 14 days for medical inspection. After 14 days of medical inspection, arriving personal will be asked to follow the stay home order for another 14 days. Meanwhile, two COVID testings and one antibody testing are required. Arrivals from high infected areas, which include but not limited to Heilongjiang Province, Neimenggu Province, Liaoning Province, Guangdong Province, and Beijing Province, will need to present a negative COVID test result within a week and healthy self-reporting report history or will be denied to enter.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
From 24 April 2020, Inner Mongolia is implementing a two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations classified as “middle-risk and high-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province;  Baiyun district and Yuexiu district in Guangdong province; Beijing’s Chaoyang District (adjusted according to the situation dynamically ). They enter Inner Mongolia will be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.

From 12 am on 10 May 2020, Inner Mongolia cancels the two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations where already adjusted from “medium-risk and high-risk zones” to “low-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province. They enter Inner Mongolia will not be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)

After their seven-day quarantine period is over, those tested negative will be transferred from quarantine sites in Shanghai to the Kunshan Transfer Base by dedicated staff and vehicles of Jiangsu Province in a seamless and hermetic manner and then start another seven days isolated health observation.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Tongliao City is enforcing a two-week quarantine on people who ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant" between 12:30 pm and 13:50 pm on August 25, 2020. Because on August 25, five close contacts of COVID-19 from other provinces had transferred trains in Tongliao City. During the period from 12:30 pm to 13:50 pm, they ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant". People who ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant" between 12:30 pm and 13:50 pm on August 25 should actively contact the local CDC, be quarantined for medical observation for 14 days and accept temperature check twice daily in the morning and evening.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: Quarantine policies for international travelers to Shanghai with their final destination in neighboring Jiangsu, Zhejiang, or Anhui provinces who tests negative after three days of quarantine in Shanghai－instead of the current seven days－will be transferred to their city of destination to finish the last 11 days of quarantine in designated places, starting on 12th September 2020.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On October 25, 2020, Ordos, Inner Mongolia requires people who travelled from Kashgar, Xinjiang since October 10 have entered Ordos, who must provide a negative result of nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days or a health QR code includes the negative result of nucleic acid test information within 7 days. They can move freely and orderly under the premise of normal body temperature and effective personal protection. If people are unable to provide a negative result of nucleic acid test information or have not yet undergone the nucleic acid test, they must conduct centralised quarantine and nucleic acid testing immediately. Those people can flow in an orderly manner after the nucleic acid test result is negative.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description:
On October 26, 2020, Bayannur, Inner Mongolia requires people who travelled from Kashgar, Xinjiang since October 10 have entered Bayannur, who must provide a negative result of nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days or a health QR code includes the negative result of nucleic acid test information within 7 days. 

If people cannot provide those mentioned above negative nucleic acid test information, they will be immediate centralized quarantine and complete the nucleic acid test within 24 hours. If people receive the nucleic acid test result is positive, they will be immediately sent to designated medical institutions to receive treatment in isolation. 

All close contacts of confirmed cases and asymptomatic coronavirus carriers will be subject to the control measure of "14-day centralized medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test".
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

The units and contractors must keep track of the dynamic information of construction workers in time, do proper investigation and registration, and pay attention to the workers' health status. description: On January 28, 2020, the Hubei Provincial Grain Bureau ordered all kinds of grain and oil enterprises in the province, under relevant requirements and territorial management principles, to complete consciously various tasks assigned by the party committee, government, and epidemic prevention and control headquarters, actively cooperate with the main grain administrative department to form emergency plans in time, and open “assurance” grain and oil distribution centers and stores as soon as possible, to ensure the normal supply of grain and oil and actively maintain a good market order.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description:
On January 28, 2020, the Hubei Provincial Grain Bureau ordered all kinds of grain and oil enterprises in the province to increase consciously grain and oil production and supply, strengthen overall planning, and try to connect effectively grain and oil processing, storage, transportation, distribution, and supply to maintain a smooth operation of all links, ensuring that grain and oil supply would not be out of stock, and increasing the market’s ability to react in emergency and distribution capabilities. 

The enterprises should cooperate with government regulation, patiently and meticulously publicize and explain to consumers information based on facts, such as sufficient grain and oil stocks, ample market supply, and perfect grain reserve emergency system, and guide consumers to buy grain nearby and rationally, and avoid queuing up and panic buying.

The enterprises should also do proper and safe disinfection of on-the-job personnel and the work site, strictly require them to wear protective equipment to work, and strengthen temperature measurement and inspection. The enterprises should arrange properly the working and boarding of employees during holidays, and care about their health. They should improve the emergency plan for epidemic prevention and control and deal with problems found according to relevant requirements in time.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 28, 2020, the Local Financial Supervision Administration of Hubei ordered financial institutions to urge their personnel to raise awareness of scientific prevention and control, to learn and master prevention knowledge and measures, and to rationally view the development, prevention, and control of the epidemic. 
The units must seriously conduct in-store disinfection and fully grasp the whereabouts of their personnel. They must establish a daily report and investigation system with specified implementation personnel and urge all personnel to report every day. If personnel or their family members had confirmed or suspected cases of the novel coronavirus infected pneumonia, the units must promptly report to local disease prevention and control agencies and urge the infected to see a doctor or take corresponding quarantine measures.

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered the Housing and Construction Departments of all levels to strengthen the safety protection of environmental sanitation operators and front-line law enforcement team members. All front-line personnel must take safe and effective protective measures during the epidemic prevention and control period. All units must distribute masks, gloves, and other protective equipment in full to prevent infection of workers. The departments must organize training and guidance for sanitation and cleaning personnel, teach them correct protection methods, and prevent cross-infection due to lack of protection. The departments must reasonably arrange work and rest, scientifically control labor intensity, and prevent problems such as excessive fatigue.

They must strengthen the reporting of information, establish a daily reporting system for personnel control and epidemic prevention and control of the unit, and accurately report relevant information.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels within the province to strengthen the protective measures for employees, and fully manage the movements and actions of personnel. The departments must effectively strengthen the responsibilities of emergency duty posts and strictly implement the 24-hour special-person on-duty and leadership-led shift system. The departments must strengthen information reporting and implement a “daily report” system for the outbreak of new coronavirus infection pneumonia.

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to comply with the Ministry of Civil Affairs’ “Guidelines for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Outbreak of Elderly Care Institutions,’’ formulate an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strengthen the primary responsibility of the institution directors, strengthen personnel investigation, and monitor their epidemic cases. The institutions should put cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus into quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, while reporting and assisting in investigations. Institutional staff must strictly implement disinfection, temperature measurement, and other preventive controls.
The institutions should emphasize mental adaptability of the elderly and staff to relieve anxiety and fear, pay close attention to the physical conditions of the elderly every day in time, measure the body temperature of the staff twice a day, regularly open windows for ventilation, regularly implement disinfection to maintain environmental hygiene within the institutions, and carry out knowledge education on epidemic prevention and control for staff and elderly residents in institutions.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to implement temporary closed management. During the temporary closed management period, they must cancel all elderly outings and family visits; the elderly who had taken leave and left could return to the hospital after inspection and evaluation after the epidemic ended; they should not take in new elderly. Except for personnel providing work security, medical security, logistical security, and prevention and control guidance, other unrelated personnel might not enter. Elderly residents might not leave without authorization. For elderly persons who really need to go out for medical reasons, the staff shall help them take protective measures.
The institutions should cancel gathering activities and dining. They should guide the elderly to stay in their own rooms as much as possible, or organize outdoor activities in batches. They should encourage relatives and children to use WeChat, video calls, and phone calls to express greetings to the elderly.
Other organizations with elderly care should conduct closed management as an elderly care institution.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all home-based elderly care service organizations in the province to suspend home-visit service and temporary close all street day care centers for the elderly, home-based service centers for the elderly in urban and rural communities, meal stations for the elderly, and other service facilities. For the disabled (dementia) elderly at home, if there was a real need for home-visit nursing services, the visiting personnel shall conduct home services after the dispatched agency assessed their health and improved relevant protective measures, and shall clean and disinfect the elderly’s homes.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to implement temporary closed management. They should cancel all kinds of collective activities, decline all kinds of volunteer services, parties, and condolences; people outside the hospital who must enter for work must not come into contact with children in the children’s living area. The institutions must carefully register, do temperature measurement, disinfection, etc. on entering and exiting personnel, and those with fever might not enter. The institutions must cancel children’s collective play activities and avoid them going to densely populated public places. For cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus, the institutions should put them under quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, and report and assist in investigation.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to maintain hygiene in children’s living environment and food. They should open windows of children’s living areas and activity rooms regularly every day for ventilation to maintain indoor air circulation, wipe and disinfect children’s bed rails, toys, tables and chairs regularly, and record the wiping and disinfection work. They should regularly carry out children's temperature monitoring, restrict children from drinking unboiled water or eating raw or cold food, avoid their sharing of water cups, tableware, towels, toothbrushes and other items, let them thoroughly clean hands with running water before and after meals, to develop good hygiene habits.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to strengthen the self-protection of staff. The staff must wear work clothes and masks, wash hands frequently, and develop good hygiene during work. They must wash and disinfect their hands before serving and feeding children. When the staff accompany children to the hospital, they must take various protective measures. During the work period, the institutions must check on all staff regularly. If they had fever, cough and other suspected symptoms, the institutions must put them under quarantine, send them to medical treatment in time, and report relevant information.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to do proper prevention and control of the epidemic situation for inbound and on-site personnel. All rescue and management agencies shall open up emergency quarantine observation areas for epidemic prevention and control, equipped with infrared forehead thermometers and sanitary and epidemic prevention materials. They should ask new arrivals about their physical condition and temperature; transfer those found to have fever, fatigue, cough and other symptoms immediately to an independent observation area for observation or to a hospital for examination.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to do proper sanitation management. They should reinforce sanitation and cleaning, change and wash clothes and quilts in time, open windows regularly for ventilation, conduct regular site disinfection, maintain environmental sanitation of the institution, and ensure the safety of medication and catering.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to reinforce the self-protection of the staff. They should carry out epidemic prevention and control education for staff, properly monitor the body temperature of personnel entering and leaving the agencies, and implement a daily health report system for personnel. They should strengthen the contact and linkage mechanism with the health and epidemic prevention departments to ensure responding and handling problems in a timely manner. Without special circumstances, during the Spring Festival, the agencies should not send and pick up people served at the agencies.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered funeral homes to strengthen the protective measures for funeral workers. They should equip funeral service personnel with masks, disinfectants, thermometers and other necessary protective equipment, and staff who came into contact with the remains of patients with new pneumonia (including suspected patients) should implement the most stringent protective measures. They should reinforce the epidemic prevention and control of key areas such as the business halls, service negotiation rooms, and ash collection areas, set up special reception desks, allow no more than 2 family members to handle the business at a time, and adopt methods such as wearing masks, measuring body temperature, washing and disinfecting hands, reinforcing the safety and protection of front-line workers. The funeral homes must strictly disinfect all workplaces and ventilate facilities to eliminate all hidden dangers that may spread the virus.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should cremate the remains of patients with COVID-19 (including suspected patients) who died in the burial reform areas. For those died in counties (cities, districts) without cremation facilities, the municipal (prefecture) Civil Affairs department should report to the local epidemic prevention headquarters, and designate funeral parlors to send special vehicles to pick the remains up and conduct cremation nearby. All funeral homes shall set up special passages, special funeral vehicles, special cremation machines and isolation areas. After completing the relevant procedures such as death certificates, handover of the remains, and approval of cremation, the funeral homes should transport the deceased’s remains directly to the cremation room for cremation. During the handover of the remains, the funeral homes must confirm that medical and health institutions had carried out sanitation and epidemic prevention treatment.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should advise families of the deceased not to hold farewell ceremonies. After receiving a telephone appointment, the funeral homes must properly transport the remains, and advise the families of the deceased to reduce the number of people attending funerals and not to hold farewell ceremonies. If the family members still insisted on holding farewell ceremonies, the funeral homes must strictly control the scale of attendance and take corresponding prevention and control measures.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that for non-relatives and -friends of the deceased, all cemeteries, ashes halls and other ashes storage facilities in the province would be closed. Except for the needs of ashes placement, the ashes storage facilities should prohibit other personnel from entering and exiting, and suspend all sacrifice and sweeping activities.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Provincial Welfare Lottery Center, the City and State Management Station, and the Zhongfu Sales Agencies with Online Agreements to postpone the opening of the welfare lottery market. After the resumption of the market, they must implement the epidemic prevention and control requirements for business sites strictly. They must open windows regularly for ventilation, regular cleaning, and disinfection of welfare lottery sales agencies and various operations, maintaining environmental sanitation. Before the epidemic ended, staff and sales personnel should wear masks and other protective equipment to work. Lottery ticket buyers entering sales agencies or operations should wear masks as requested.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
