description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to sort out the situations of their staff going out during the holiday carefully. If the staff had a history of contact with people diagnosed with COVID-19, they should consciously go into quarantine and observe; if they had suspected symptoms such as fever and cough, they should seek medical treatment in time and report to the local disease control department.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to establish a temperature monitoring system for employees and staff after the holiday. The departments should strictly manage the entry and exit of outsiders, and all visitors shall register and measure their body temperature. For public spaces such as canteens, meeting rooms, and offices, the departments should carry out disinfection and opening windows for ventilation regularly. The departments should also simplify meetings, reduce personnel gathering, and arrange and carry out work through video and telephone conferences and work chat groups as much as possible.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to apply to establish a fast and convenient medical channel for personnel of civil service agencies. The departments should implement the "two teams on duty simultaneously" and "report even with zero cases" systems. All localities and units must develop an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strictly conduct regular duty on holiday and duty for emergency epidemic prevention, and strictly implement the mechanism of leadership on duty, 24-hour duty on important positions, and the information reporting system.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Higher People's Court of Hubei announced that during the epidemic prevention and control period, litigation service centers of courts at all levels in the province would be closed and not take in case applications. For people intending to file a case in court, the Court recommended them to do so online through channels such as Hubei Court Litigation Service (http://www.hbfy.org/electronic court section), Hubei Mobile WeChat Court (adding the WeChat Miniprogram via mobile phone). For those finding online filing inconvenient, the Court recommended them to mail their application materials to the relevant court.

type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: Most provinces have set start dates for schools as the epidemic ebbs with nearly zero domestic cases reported since March. According to the arrangements of the Ministry of Education, Shandong Province, combined with the actual situation of school's control work, and after the school’s research, it is scheduled to organize students to return to school in batches and staggered peaks from May 23, 2020. The specific return time and related requirements will be notified to each student by the school. Students who have not received the notification will not return to school temporarily. description: Large-scale gatherings such as attending dinner parties and banquets are strictly prohibited in Manzhouli, Inner Mongolia from November 21, 2020, because Inner Mongolia reported two new confirmed cases of Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia from Manzhouli.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted

description: Commercial performances in Beijing have been banned from Jan. 1 until the holiday (Feb 11).
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia advocated "non-necessary not to organize", and people should strictly simplify and reduce large-scale gathering activities from January 7, 2021. Each level of party and government, enterprises and institutions must strictly control the quantity and scale of large-scale meetings and events. Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention recommended online meetings, such as video conferencing. In principle, government agencies and companies must not hold training, mass greetings, parties, large-scale temple fairs, annual meetings as well as offline exhibitions and promotions.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: On January 7, 2021, Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that under the strict implementation of various prevention and control measures, libraries, museums, art galleries and other indoor venues; theatres and other performance venues; Internet service venues; live entertainment venues; amusement entertainment venues; off-campus training institutions, above places had to ensure it does not exceed 75% of the maximum capacity of people.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: On January 7, 2021, Chifeng Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced requirements for holding wedding banquets. Wedding banquets have to reduce the number of guests. People who come from outside of Chifeng City can not be invited. Except for wedding banquets, family private parties and dinners should be limited to fewer than 10 people.
type_sub_cat: Events at private residencies restricted (e.g. parties held at home)

description: China, Guangdong province will enforce closed management to each residential area (using each residential development as the unit) starting on Feb 14, 2020. Limited access to all visitors' entry to the residential area except deliveries. All entry points will be guarded by a gateman 24 hours and each entry point will be equipped with at least one Infrared thermometer. In case of the absence of the gateman or detected body temperature exceeding 37.3 C, no entry will be allowed.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country
